means.word_mean: 安眠的,止痛的;使平静的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French narcotique, via medieval Latin from Greek narkōtikos, from narkoun 'make numb'

entry.tran: 致幻毒品;麻醉品;(泛指)毒品(亦写作narcotics，尤用于美国英语中)
entry.def: Narcotics are drugs such as opium or heroin which make you sleepy and stop you feeling pain. You can also use narcotics, especially in American English, to mean any kind of illegal drug.

example.ex: He was indicted for dealing in narcotics...
example.tran: 他因从事毒品交易被起诉。

example.ex: He appears to be high on some sort of narcotic.
example.tran: 他看起来飘飘欲仙，像是吸食了某种毒品。

entry.tran: (尤指药物)麻醉的，致幻的，催眠的
entry.def: If something, especially a drug, has a narcotic effect, it makes the person who uses it feel sleepy.

example.ex: ...hormones that have a narcotic effect on the immune system.
example.tran: 对免疫系统有麻醉作用的激素

means.word_mean: 1. a drug that produces numbness or stupor; often taken for pleasure or to reduce pain; extensive use can lead to addiction
1. of or relating to or designating narcotics;
